trans-unit.source: Enumerate and query files and folders
trans-unit.target: Enumerate and query files and folders

trans-unit.source: Access files and folders in either a folder, library, device, or network location.
trans-unit.target: Access files and folders in either a folder, library, device, or network location.

trans-unit.source: You can also query the files and folders in a location by constructing file and folder queries.
trans-unit.target: You can also query the files and folders in a location by constructing file and folder queries.

trans-unit.source: Enumerate and query files and folders
trans-unit.target: Enumerate and query files and folders

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Access files and folders in either a folder, library, device, or network location.
trans-unit.target: Access files and folders in either a folder, library, device, or network location.

trans-unit.source: You can also query the files and folders in a location by constructing file and folder queries.
trans-unit.target: You can also query the files and folders in a location by constructing file and folder queries.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Also see the [Folder enumeration sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619993).
trans-unit.target: **Note** Also see the [Folder enumeration sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619993).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).
trans-unit.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).

trans-unit.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).
trans-unit.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).

trans-unit.source: Access permissions to the location
trans-unit.target: Access permissions to the location

trans-unit.source: For example, the code in these examples require the **picturesLibrary** capability, but your location may require a different capability or no capability at all.
trans-unit.target: For example, the code in these examples require the **picturesLibrary** capability, but your location may require a different capability or no capability at all.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).

trans-unit.source: Enumerate files and folders in a location
trans-unit.target: Enumerate files and folders in a location

trans-unit.source: **Note** Remember to declare the **picturesLibrary** capability.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Remember to declare the **picturesLibrary** capability.

trans-unit.source: In this example we first use the [**StorageFolder.GetFilesAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227276) method to get all the files in the root folder of the [**PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227156) (not in subfolders) and list the name of each file.
trans-unit.target: In this example we first use the [**StorageFolder.GetFilesAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227276) method to get all the files in the root folder of the [**PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227156) (not in subfolders) and list the name of each file.

trans-unit.source: Next, we use the [**GetFoldersAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227280) method to get all the subfolders in the **PicturesLibrary** and list the name of each subfolder.
trans-unit.target: Next, we use the [**GetFoldersAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227280) method to get all the subfolders in the **PicturesLibrary** and list the name of each subfolder.

trans-unit.source: **Note** In C# or Visual Basic, remember to put the **async** keyword in the method declaration of any method in which you use the **await** operator.
trans-unit.target: **Note** In C# or Visual Basic, remember to put the **async** keyword in the method declaration of any method in which you use the **await** operator.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use the [**GetItemsAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227286) method to get all items (both files and subfolders) in a particular location.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use the [**GetItemsAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227286) method to get all items (both files and subfolders) in a particular location.

trans-unit.source: The following example uses the **GetItemsAsync** method to get all files and subfolders in the root folder of the [**PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227156) (not in subfolders).
trans-unit.target: The following example uses the **GetItemsAsync** method to get all files and subfolders in the root folder of the [**PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227156) (not in subfolders).

trans-unit.source: Then the example lists the name of each file and subfolder.
trans-unit.target: Then the example lists the name of each file and subfolder.

trans-unit.source: If the item is a subfolder, the example appends `"folder"` to the name.
trans-unit.target: If the item is a subfolder, the example appends `"folder"` to the name.

trans-unit.source: Query files in a location and enumerate matching files
trans-unit.target: Query files in a location and enumerate matching files

trans-unit.source: In this example we query for all the files in the [**PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227156) grouped by the month, and this time the example recurses into subfolders.
trans-unit.target: In this example we query for all the files in the [**PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227156) grouped by the month, and this time the example recurses into subfolders.

trans-unit.source: First, we call [**StorageFolder.CreateFolderQuery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227262) and pass the [**CommonFolderQuery.GroupByMonth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207957) value to the method.
trans-unit.target: First, we call [**StorageFolder.CreateFolderQuery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227262) and pass the [**CommonFolderQuery.GroupByMonth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207957) value to the method.

trans-unit.source: That gives us a [**StorageFolderQueryResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208066) object.
trans-unit.target: That gives us a [**StorageFolderQueryResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208066) object.

trans-unit.source: Next we call [**StorageFolderQueryResult.GetFoldersAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208074) which returns [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) objects representing virtual folders.
trans-unit.target: Next we call [**StorageFolderQueryResult.GetFoldersAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208074) which returns [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) objects representing virtual folders.

trans-unit.source: In this case we're grouping by month, so the virtual folders each represent a group of files with the same month.
trans-unit.target: In this case we're grouping by month, so the virtual folders each represent a group of files with the same month.

trans-unit.source: The output of the example looks similar to the following.
trans-unit.target: The output of the example looks similar to the following.
